name: Grilled Arctic Char on Bed of Greens
author: AvelaineS
summary: Arctic char is a close cousin of the salmon, with a much milder and sophisticated flavor. It might be too pricey and hard to find when not in season depending where you live, so feel free to substitute salmon. This is a delicious, light, and satisfying meal.
directions: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a grill pan or skillet over medium-high heat
Season arctic char with kosher salt and black pepper
Cook fillets on grill pan skin side up until lightly browned, 3 to 4 minutes
Flip fillets and continue to cook until fish flakes easily with a fork, 3 to 4 minutes more
Pour lemon juice over fish; remove from heat
Divide salad greens over two plates and arrange mango, strawberries, and pecans on top; season with salt and black pepper
Carefully place an arctic char fillet on each portion and drizzle pan juices and remaining 2 teaspoon olive oil over salads
